column1: Fortuny won his own opportunities. He took a prize
column3: which made it possible for him to go to Rome where he wished to study art. He did not spend his time studying and copying the old masters as did most artists who went there
column6: he studied the life of the Roman streets.He had already been at the Academy of Barcelona
column7: but he did not follow his first master; instead
column8: he struck out a line of art for himself. After a year in Rome the artist went to war; but he did not go to fight men
column10: and his weapon was his sketch book. He went with General Prim
column11: and he filled his book with warlike scenes and the brilliant skies of Morocco. From that time his work was inspired by his Moorish experiences.
